base_description: Rectangular, gray keyboard with standard layout.
part_description: Contains multiple rows of rectangular keys, evenly spaced, including alphanumeric keys, function keys, and a numeric keypad on the right.
internal_interaction_description: Keys are arranged in a grid pattern, allowing for tactile feedback when pressed. Each key is spring-loaded, returning to its original position after being pressed. The numeric keypad is separated on the right, facilitating data entry.
external_interaction_description: Interacts with computers via a wired or wireless connection, allowing users to input data and commands. Users press keys to type text, execute shortcuts, and control software applications, enhancing computer usability.
